pr_title: ISPN-12260 Don't use JMX to compute global server connection stats

timeline.message: ISPN-12260 Don't use JMX to compute global server connection stats

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think using getQualifiedName() is ok, because the javadoc of ProtocolServerConfigurationBuilder.name() says
    * Specifies a custom name for this server in order to easily distinguish it from other servers, e.g. via JMX. Defaults to the empty string.

and at least some of our tests have interpreted that as "set a different name on each node".
timeline.author: danberindei

replies.bodyText:
The test then needs to be fixed: the original jmx code uses getQualifiedName() as well.
The intention of name() is to give different endpoints of the same type on the same instance a unique name. I'll add a note specifying that it needs to be the same across the cluster.
